definition: according to reason/usually/in the normal course of events/to attend to
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
variant of 照[zhao4]/to shine/to illuminate
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: College students are supposed to be calm and cool under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 大学生照理在任何情况下都应保持沉著和冷静。

sentences.english: It's winter time. It's supposed to be cold in here.
sentences.chinese: 现在是冬天，这里照理应该很冷。

sentences.english: They must have seen them together for ever.
sentences.chinese: 照理应该常常看到他们两人在一起呀。

sentences.english: So earnest an effort was well deserving of a better reward.
sentences.chinese: 尽心竭力，照理应该得到较好的结果。

sentences.english: The pig had died three times, and accordingly he should not be reborn.
sentences.chinese: 猪已经死了三次了，照理说，不能再生了。

sentences.english: Logically, who would want to kill fighters against Japan?
sentences.chinese: 照理说，什么人要杀抗日战士呢？

sentences.english: Between takes, it would have been tempting to go outside and have a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 照理说，场间休息时出去抽根烟应该是很爽的。

definition: according to reason/in the ordinary course of events/normally
in the ordinary course of events/ordinarily/normally
to calculate/to estimate/in total/all told/(fig.) if you think about it
normally/ordinarily speaking
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
this/the present (meeting etc)/this time/this once
to be worthwhile/to be worth it
certainly/of course
good and bad/most unfortunate occurrence/in any case/whatever
to execute by hanging
senior figure/elder/doyen
Zhang Ji (767-830), Tang Dynasty poet
therefore
to seem/to appear/(in a negative or interrogative sentence) to be sure
not the only/not merely/not simply
at most/at best
